docs.title: Welcome to EviForge
docs.text: EviForge is a professional, offline-first digital forensics platform designed for defensive security operations.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Offline-First: No data leaves your machine. Evidence is stored in a local "Vault".
  • Defensible: Strict Chain-of-Custody logging and hash verification.
  • Modular: Run various forensic modules (inventory, timeline, strings, etc.) on your evidence.
  • Secure: Application auditing and "Authorized Use Only" gates.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Check out the Quickstart guide to spin up the platform.

docs.title: Quickstart
docs.text:
1. Clone & Build: 

    git clone https://github.com/mtarza13/ForenScope.git
cd ForenScope
docker compose up -d --build

  2. Login: Navigate to http://localhost/web. Default Creds: admin / admin.

  3. Start an Investigation:

    • Create a Case.
    • Ingest evidence from the import/ directory.
    • Run Modules to analyze artifacts.

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: The EviForge API is documented via OpenAPI (Swagger).

docs.title: Access
docs.text:
• Local: http://localhost:8000/docs
  • Prod: http://localhost/api/docs

docs.title: Cases
docs.text:
• GET /cases
  • POST /cases

docs.title: Evidence
docs.text:
• GET /cases/{id}/evidence
  • POST /cases/{id}/evidence (Ingest)

docs.title: Jobs
docs.text:
• POST /jobs (Run Module)
  • GET /jobs/{id} (Status)

docs.title: Self-Check (Doctor)
docs.text:
Run the built-in doctor to verify tools: 

docker compose exec api python3 -m eviforge.doctor

docs.title: Unit Tests
docs.text:
Run the test suite: 

docker compose exec worker pytest

docs.title: Forensic Modules
docs.text: EviForge includes a suite of verified forensic modules.

docs.title: 1. Inventory
docs.text:
• Goal: Catalog all files in the evidence image.
  • Output: JSON/CSV list with MD5/SHA256 hashes.
  • Status: ✅ Active

docs.title: 2. Timeline (MACE)
docs.text:
• Goal: Extract Modified, Accessed, Created, Entry times.
  • Output: Chronological event list.
  • Status: ✅ Active

docs.title: 3. Strings
docs.text:
• Goal: Extract printable ASCII/Unicode strings.
  • Output: JSON with offset and string content.
  • Status: ✅ Active

docs.title: 4. Exif Metadata
docs.text:
• Goal: Extract Exif/IPTC/XMP metadata from images.
  • Output: JSON dictionary.
  • Status: ✅ Active

docs.title: 5. Parse Text (Tika)
docs.text:
• Goal: Extract text content from PDF, DOCX, HTML, etc.
  • Output: Plain text and metadata.
  • Status: ✅ Active

docs.title: 6. Triage
docs.text:
• Goal: Assess file entropy and type integrity (Magic vs Extension).
  • Output: Risk score and anomaly flags.
  • Status: ✅ Active

docs.title: Security Model
docs.text: EviForge is designed for LOCAL use but includes controls for "Bastion Host" deployment.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
• Admin Token: Automated access via X-Admin-Token header.
  • Web Login: Secure HTTPOnly Cookie (JWT).

docs.title: Authorization
docs.text:
• Admin: Full system access.
  • User: Case operations only (future roadmap).

docs.title: Chain of Custody
docs.text: Every action (Ingest, Job Run, Export) is cryptographically logged in chain_of_custody.log and the Database. - Prev Hash: Links to previous event. - Integrity: Cannot delete logs without breaking chain.

docs.title: Privacy (OSINT)
docs.text: The Optimization for Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) module is strictly LIMITED: - Defensive Use: Tracking "Opt-Out" requests only. - No Scrapers: No tools to scrape social media or breach ToS.
